title: Variational quantum algorithm for non-Markovian quantum dynamics
authors: Peter L. Walters, Mohammad U. Sherazi, Fei Wang
abstract:
The simulation of non-Markovian quantum dynamics plays an important role in
the understanding of charge and exciton dynamics in the condensed phase
environment, and yet it remains computationally expensive on classical
computers. We have developed a variational quantum algorithm that is capable of
simulating non-Markovian quantum dynamics. The algorithm captures the
non-Markovian effect by employing the Ehrenfect trajectories in the path
integral formulation and the Monte Carlo sampling of the thermal distribution.
We tested the algorithm with the spin-boson model on the quantum simulator and
the results match well with the exact ones. The algorithm naturally fits into
the parallel computing platform of the NISQ devices and is well suited for
anharmonic system-bath interactions and multi-state systems.
